SENT.plain: Percutaneous transluminal angioplasty (PTA) of supra-aortic arteries is not generally accepted, mainly because of the fear of brain embolism
The design of a new catheter offers four conduits and permits (1) guidewire conduct, (2) tip occlusion; (3) PTA; and (4) rinsing between occluded tip and dilational balloon
Thus, any particles that might otherwise cause brain embolism could be washed out after PTA and before opening of the tip occlusion
The prototype has already been manufactured
The catheter is easy to handle
